dtliExcerpt: Under the direction of Tim Carroll, this production emphasizes the play's darker undercurrents while maintaining its essential warmth and humor.
bwwExcerpt: The stagings, which mark the Broadway debut of Shakespeare's Globe, find Rylance - a former Globe artistic director - leading an all-male company helmed by Tim Carroll. Other practices of the playwright's day are observed; Jenny Tiramani's handsome, resourceful set is lit chiefly by candles, and her costumes hand-stitched based on 16th-century designs...What matters, of course, is the actors' authenticity once the plays begin; and they are, generally, as magnificent as you would expect.
